page.title: 13Footpaths South of Oakley
page.content: Several numbered{bridleways and foot- {paths}are clearly signposted and used frequently for leisure. One bridleway runs north from{Southwood Farm}and skirts the west of Kempshott until it joins{Kempshott Lane.}A footpath skirts the south-westerly edge of {South Wood}across fairly high farmland with good views to the north-west. It passes the eastern fringe of{Bull's {Bushes Copse,}crosses the railway line, via a bridge, then into Oakley, emerging opposite the{Post Office. A bridleway runs from east to west of the area crossing{Pardown}and skirting the north of Bull's Bushes Copse before going on to{Steventon.}Seven other shorter paths are located within the area including those at Kempshott Park crossing the golf course and the motorway,{Oakley Park,}South Wood, {Breach Farm}and three at{Peak Copse.}
